title: Junior Software Engineer
description: Junior Software Engineer  Position Description  The successful candidate will have experience within an agile environment (preferably SAFe Agile) and will have experience with a combination of back end and front-end development utilizing some of the following technologies:• Java• Docker, Kubernetes, AWS• Postgres, Spring boot, Cloud Foundry, Restful services• Eureka, Kibana, ActiveMQ, IntelliJ, Jenkins technical environment.• typescript, nodejs, twitter bootstrap• Nice to have: Python, Ruby, AngularLooking for the following qualities:• Resourcefulness - ability and desire to dig in to solve problems,• Aptitude and willingness to learn and grow while having fun on a dynamic team,• Excellent communication skills and ability to communicate clearly with clients and team members in other locations,• Leadership - ability to provide leadership within the team,• Personable and able to have a laugh while being focused to work towards deadlines.Responsibilities will include:• Pointing user stories• Working within scrum teams consisting of PO, SM, other engineers, and testers• Understanding requirements within user stories• Owning user stories and working independently• Troubleshooting and working within a team structure of 5 - 10 team members• Unit testing work• Ability to do more complex testing on user stories (that you didn't code) when the team needs to swarm at end of sprint• Deploying into a pipeline• Being client-facing, so excellent written and verbal communication• Raising and mitigating risks within a team• Overcoming issues - resourcefulness!Excellent verbal and written communication skills are a must.Required qualification to be successful in this role:- Agile/Scrum experience- 2 years Java experience, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS, Spring, Restful Services, Javascript, Javascript frameworks.Postgres, Spring boot, Cloud Foundry, Restful services, Eureka, Kibana, ActiveMQ, IntelliJ, Jenkins, typescript, nodejs, twitter bootstrap- 2+ years of SW engineering- Analytical skills: Detail oriented with ability to critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a more general understanding, distinguish presented user requests from the underlying true needs, and distinguish solution ideas from requirements.- Organizational skills: Ability to work with the information gathered during requirements analysis and to exercise flexibility with changing business priorities- Interpersonal skills: Must be able to help negotiate priorities and to resolve conflicts among representatives from various business and development teams- Team skills: Works will with others, delivers positive energy to their teamTime Management skills: Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment and consistently meet deadlines and work independently with minimal supervisionCGI is required by law in some jurisdictions to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. The determination of this range includes various factors not limited to skill set, level, experience, relevant training, and licensure and certifications. To support the ability to reward for merit-based performance, CGI typically does not hire individuals at or near the top of the range for their role. Compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range for this role in the U.S. is $ 67,000-146,900 #CGIFederalJob#Dice#LI-AD1Your future duties and responsibilitiesRequired qualifications to be successful in this roleInsights you can act onWhile technology is at the heart of our clients' digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success. When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today - one of the world's largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services. At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist. Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI - where your ideas and actions make a difference.Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics.CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at US_Employment_Compliance@cgi.com . You will need to reference the requisition number of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a requisition number will not be returned.We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Click here to be directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service members.All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to successfully complete a background investigation. Background investigation components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US government security clearance held. CGI will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrests and conviction records in accordance with all local regulations and ordinances.CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI's legal duty to furnish information.Report this jobDice Id: cgiamsbotPosition Id: 2185_J0423-0297

title: Jr. Software Developer
description: We are seeking a junior software developer proficient in programming with C# and VB.Net. The ideal candidate must have experience in creating, developing, and implementing software applications.Key Responsibilities: * Design, code, test and debug software applications utilizing C# and VB.Net. * Collaborate with senior developers on design and coding tasks. * Participate in peer code reviews. * Work with the technical department to ensure that the software meets the company's standards and is functional for end-users. * Continuously update technical knowledge and skills, staying up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies. * Ensure that all software documentation is complete, clear, and up to date.Requirements: * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent. * Experience developing software using C# and VB.Net. * A strong understanding of object-oriented programming principles. * Familiarity with MSSQL and database design. * Good communication skills and experience working in a team environment. * A proactive attitude towards learning and problem-solving.Preferred: * Knowledge of ASP.Net web applications. * Experience with T-SQL or PL/SQL. * Familiarity with software assessment tools like TFS, Git, or Jira. Working with an agile environmentReport this jobDice Id: 10115369Position Id: JRSOF03757-55

title: Junior Software Developer
description: Description Talented and professional Software Developers looking for permanent work in the Denver, Colorado area might find the opportunity for them here. You'll be right for this position if you can handle being responsible for implementing new features, maintaining existing code, and refactoring existing code across a breadth of products used both internally and externally at the company. It is preferred for applicants to have a growth mindset and the ability to work both independently and with a team.Key responsibilities- Yield clear and consistent correspondences around solutions and time estimate to client-facing program management teams- Adjust and present production support- Routinely operate code-review and team up with other developers- Cooperate with Scrum team to supply precise work estimates- If you're looking for work where you can maintain and develop new features to internal and external facing software to enhance the customer experience and resolve issues on various operating systems, this job might be for you  Requirements - Less than one year of experience preferred - It is preferred for applicants to have familiarity with scrum - If you're looking for job openings and have knowledge of education standards such as QTI/APIP, SIF, AIF, you might be a good fit for this position - Experience with at least one framework/library, e.g. Vue.js, Polymer, Angular.js, React.js, Ractive.js, Knockout.js, Ember.js, Bootstrap, etc.- Solid understanding of Java - This position will be the best fit for a candidate with experience with software development life cycles, e.g. Agile, Big Bang, Spiral, Waterfall, etc.- Prior work with API design - This position will be the best fit for a candidate who can write clean, standardized code that performs optimally in highly concurrent environments - If you're looking for job openings and have familiarity with full-stack development (front-end, to middle/application tier, to database), you might be a good fit for this position    Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®Robert Half is the world's first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity - even on the go. Download the Robert Half app and get 1-tap apply, instant notifications for AI-matched jobs, and more.All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Benefits are available to contract/temporary professionals, including medical, vision, dental, and life and disability insurance. Hired contract/temporary professionals are also eligible to enroll in our company 401(k) plan. Visit roberthalf.gobenefits.net for more information.© 2023 Robert Half. An Equal Opportunity Employer. We understand communication is key to finding the right job that matches your skills and career goals. For us, it's not just the work that we do; it's how we do the work. title: Junior Software Engineer -Remote -...
description: Description:The client  is looking for a Software Engineer/Developer to join the authentication services team supporting the Department of Defense (DoD) High Performance Computing Modernization Program (DoD HPCMP).  This is a virtual position that can be accomplished from anywhere in the continental US.The successful candidate will support the development, testing, and deployment of authentication and identity management capabilities enabling access to DoD supercomputers and infrastructure across multiple locations.  Responsibilities will include working with a team of developers and engineers to review and define configurations, develop and update authentication applications and services, and develop and implement testing processes.Flexibility in approach to finding solutions is essential, as well as the ability to understand and act on the customer needs and priorities and learn new technologies quickly. Occasional off-hours activity will be required to perform updates and take part in service restoration efforts. Responsibilities include:Provides support in software development phases that include, but are not limited to:Design (database, GUI, web services, standalone applications)Performance TuningDevelopment and maintenance of authentication applications using multiple languagesUnit and Integration TestingRelease/Patch BuildDeployment/Installation in test and production environmentsUses applicable methodologies, modeling/estimating techniques, tools, applications, systems, software, and databases to perform assigned tasks.Contributes to or develops technical documentation (e.g., Test Cases, Test Plan, updates to application administration documentation) Required Skills and ExperienceRecent experience with C/C++, Python, Perl, and Linux Bash scripting.Experience with writing SQL queries, SQL query optimization, and SQL development tools such as Oracle SQL DeveloperFamiliarity with authentication systems and protocols, including Kerberos, OpenID Connect, and two-factor authenticationFamiliarity with decomposing requirements to provide estimates for completionSelf-starter with ability to multi-task and meet deadlines consistently Desired Skills and ExperienceDevSecOps team experienceVMware Server AdministrationNetworking ExperienceGitLab use as a DevOps platform Other Requirements:Secret Security ClearanceDoD 8570 IAT II (or better) Certification (i.e. Security+) Typical Education and Experience: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or other related field/concentration and three (3) years or more experience, Additional 4 years of experience in lieu of degreeReport this jobDice Id: 91092880Position Id: 7892674

title: Junior Software Engineer / .NET...
description: A SaaS company is hiring a Junior .NET Engineer to join their team of 8. This team is highly collaborative and pretty senior, so they are looking for someone with 1-3 years of experience and a degree who wants to learn and grow in their career. This company is well-established and a very well-known software provider in its field, providing end to end solutions to customers more efficiently than competitors. In this role you will work on a variety of software applications, including their brand new client-facing platform. The main tech stack for this role is .NET 6, Rest API, Microservices, AWS Lambdas (serverless experience is a big plus), PostgreSQL, and DB2. The only requirements are .NET Core, API, and some exposure to cloud/Angular/React. This role is 40% front end development and 60% middle tier/backend development. The manager, she is highly passionate and has a clear vision for the team which consists of excellent mentors. This role requires you to live within a commutable distance to La Mirada, CA so you can commute once a week. The other four days are remote, so you must live in Southern California to apply. Required Skills & Experience  1+ years of professional .NET development Experience Bachelor's Degree in STEM Experience using ASP.NET Core Computer Science Fundamentals Experience with JavaScript Rest API SQL  Desired Skills & Experience  Excellent written and verbal communication skills Angular, cloud, or React experience Desire to learn and grow in your career  What You Will Be Doing Daily Responsibilities  40% Front End development 60% Middle Tier/Back End Development  The Offer You will receive the following benefits:  Medical Insurance Dental Benefits Vision Benefits Paid Time Off (PTO) Paid Sick Time 401(k) matching Bonus potential  Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis now and in the future.Report this jobDice Id: 10105282Position Id: 553423

title: Junior Software Environment...
description: Transform technology into opportunity as a Junior Software Environment Engineer with GDIT. A career in enterprise IT means connecting and enhancing the systems that matter most. At GDIT you'll be at the forefront of innovation and play a meaningful part in improving how agencies operate.At GDIT, people are our differentiator. As a Junior Software Environment Engineer you will help ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. Our work depends on a Junior Software Environment Engineer joining our team to support our intelligence customer in Springfield, VA or St. Louis, MO. HOW A JUNIOR SOFTWARE ENVIRONMENT ENGINEER WILL MAKE AN IMPACTThe Junior Software Environment Engineer is an active participant in SAFe and Scrum development teams and meetings. Understands DevSecOps and is able to develop/test for enterprise-wide systems and/or applications software.GDIT JOB DESCRIPTION:Incrementally build functionality for DevSecOps productsDevelop and deploy cloud-based applications securely, efficiently, and with high resiliencyParticipate in sprint planning and release planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, retrospectives, and other agile-related eventsUpdate agile tracking systems JIRA and Confluence to provide transparency on product and sprint backlogs; track and communicate overall progress against assigned user storiesWork with a scrum team to refine a prioritized backlog through story decomposition and task definition, including providing point estimates based on complexityMust meet DoD 8570 IAT Level II requirements including one of the following: Security+ CE, CND, SSCP, GSEC, GICSP, CySA+, or CCNA, or obtain certification within 90 days of hiringPromote a collaborative team environment that fosters experimentation, creativity and innovationAssist with internal and external communicationWHAT YOU'LL NEED TO SUCCEED:Required Skills:Associate's Degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical certifications or training, and work experienceUnderstanding of DevSecOps and software application development processesFamiliarity with programming or scripting languages (e.g. Javascript, Python), data structures, and techniquesExperience with web-based Knowledge Management (e.g. Confluence, SharePoint)Experience with workflow orchestration tools (e.g. GitLab, GitHub)Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skillsExperience working in dynamic team-based environmentStrong communication skillsActive TS/SCI clearance required and eligibility to obtain a CI polyDesired Skills and Certifications:3+ years of experience working within the DoD or IC CommunityExperience with Atlassian Agile Products; specifically, JIRA and ConfluenceExperience with Infrastructure as Code such as Puppet, Ansible, Chef, Salt, CloudFormation or TerraformAgile-related certification (e.g. SAFe Agilist, Certified Scrum Master)• Location: On Customer Site• US Citizenship RequiredGDIT IS YOUR PLACE:• 401K with company match• Comprehensive health and wellness packages• Internal mobility team dedicated to helping you own your career• Professional growth opportunities including paid education and certifications• Cutting-edge technology you can learn from• Rest and recharge with paid vacation and holidays#Rover2022Work Requirements.cls-1{fill:none;stroke:#5b6670;stroke-miterlimit:10;stroke-width:2px;}  Years of Experience 3 + years of related experience* may vary based on technical training, certification(s), or degree.cls-1{fill:none;stroke:#5b6670;stroke-miterlimit:10;stroke-width:2px;}  Travel Required None.cls-1{stroke-width:1.5px;}.cls-1,.cls-2,.cls-3{fill:none;stroke:#5d666f;stroke-miterlimit:10;}.cls-2{stroke-width:2px;}  Citizenship U.S. Citizenship RequiredAbout Our WorkWe are GDIT. The people supporting some of the most complex government, defense, and intelligence projects across the country. We deliver. Bringing the expertise needed to understand and advance critical missions. We transform. Shifting the ways clients invest in, integrate, and innovate technology solutions. We ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. We are there. On the ground, beside our clients, in the lab, and everywhere in between. Offering the technology transformations, strategy, and mission services needed to get the job done.  COVID-19 Vaccination GDIT does not have a vaccination mandate applicable to all employees. title: Jr. Software Environment Engineer
description: Transform technology into opportunity as a Jr. Software Environment Engineer with GDIT. A career in enterprise IT means connecting and enhancing the systems that matter most. At GDIT you'll be at the forefront of innovation and play a meaningful part in improving how agencies operate.At GDIT, people are our differentiator. As a Jr. Software Environment Engineer you will help ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. Our work depends on TS/SCI Cleared Software Environment Engineer joining our team to support our intelligence customer in Springfield, VA or St. Louis, MO. HOW A JR SOFTWARE ENVIRONMENT ENGINEER WILL MAKE AN IMPACT• Incrementally build functionality for DevSecOps product verticals• Participate in sprint planning and release planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, retrospectives, and other agile related events• Track and communicate oval progress against assigned user stories• Update agile tracking systems to provide transparency on product and sprint backlogs• Assist with internal and external communication• Provide complexity estimates through story selection and task definition• Promote a collaborative team environment that fosters experimentation, creativity and innovationWHAT YOU'LL NEED TO SUCCEED:Required Skills:• Associate's Degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical certifications or training, and work experience• Experience working in dynamic team-based environment• Understanding of DevSecOps and /or software/application development processes• Familiarity with programming or scripting languages (e.g. Javscript, Python)• Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills• Experience with web-based Knowledge Management and workflow tools• Active TS/SCI level security clearance required to start and must be able to obtain a CI PolyDesired Skills and Certifications:• 2+ years of experience working within the DoD or IC Community• Experience with Atlassian Agile Products; specifically, JIRA and Confluence• Certified Scrum Master (CSM) Certification• Sec+ certification or ability to obtain Security+ certification within 90 days of hireLocation: Springfield, VA or St, Louis, MOUS Citizenship RequiredGDIT IS YOUR PLACE:• 401K with company match• Comprehensive health and wellness packages• Internal mobility team dedicated to helping you own your career• Professional growth opportunities including paid education and certifications• Cutting-edge technology you can learn from• Rest and recharge with paid vacation and holidays#Rover2022Work Requirements.cls-1{fill:none;stroke:#5b6670;stroke-miterlimit:10;stroke-width:2px;}  Years of Experience 2 + years of related experience* may vary based on technical training, certification(s), or degree.cls-1,.cls-2{fill:none;stroke:#5b6670;stroke-miterlimit:10;}.cls-1{stroke-width:1.77px;}.cls-2{stroke-width:2px;}  Certification Certified Scrum Master (CSM) - Scrum Alliance.cls-1{fill:none;stroke:#5b6670;stroke-miterlimit:10;stroke-width:2px;}  Travel Required None.cls-1{stroke-width:1.5px;}.cls-1,.cls-2,.cls-3{fill:none;stroke:#5d666f;stroke-miterlimit:10;}.cls-2{stroke-width:2px;}  Citizenship U.S. Citizenship RequiredAbout Our WorkWe are GDIT. The people supporting some of the most complex government, defense, and intelligence projects across the country. We deliver. Bringing the expertise needed to understand and advance critical missions. We transform. Shifting the ways clients invest in, integrate, and innovate technology solutions. We ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. We are there. On the ground, beside our clients, in the lab, and everywhere in between. title: Junior Software Tester
description: Join our Dynamic Team as a Junior Software Tester - Unlock the Potential of Wireless Technology!Pay: 30-35/hrContract: 6 month CTHLocation: Littleton, CoAre you ready to dive into the world of cutting-edge wireless technology? We are seeking a passionate and detail-oriented individual to join our Wireless IT OSS Platforms department as a Junior Embedded Tester for SIM and Device Platforms. In this role, you will play a vital part in documenting and testing innovative implementations and integrations of eSIM, SIM, and Device Management technologies. If you're excited about being at the forefront of mobile product features and want to be part of a dynamic team, this is the perfect opportunity for you!Key Responsibilities:Unleash Your Testing Expertise: Collaborate with internal technical teams to identify and test platform elements necessary to support key mobile product features.Document and Innovate:Build detailed technical test requirements for systems, applications, integrations, and new products related to eSIM, SIM-OTA, and Device Management platforms.Continuous Improvement:Engage with IT and business stakeholders to identify opportunities for business, system, and process enhancements.Analysis and Documentation: Develop, analyze, prioritize, and organize requirement specifications, data mapping, diagrams, and flowcharts for developers and testers to follow.Communicate and Collaborate: Create targeted system analysis documentation for architecture teams and executives, covering design and interface considerations, data analysis, and systems testing.Subject Matter Expertise:Provide application and process expertise to business partners and IT technical resources.Agile Team Player:Contribute to sprint planning, daily standups, and other team activities as a valued member of a scrum team.Skills, Experience, and Requirements:Educational Background: Hold a BA/BS degree in a technical or business discipline (information systems, engineering, computer science, finance, business administration, or accounting).Analytical skills in modern web technologies, including web services APIs.Proficiency in analyzing relational and nonrelational database technologies.Familiarity with Serverless/Function as a service concepts, implementations & patterns, webscale, and distributed systems.Strong problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.Ability to assess business needs and translate them into effective solutions.Excellent organizational, written, and verbal communication skills.Collaboration skills with a proven ability to work well in cross-functional and distributedenvironments.Understanding and experience using Agile processes and methodologies.Capacity to handle changing priorities while planning for the future.Experience with Rally/CA Agile Central is a plus.Eight Eleven Group provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to
